org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.components.kineticcomponent

Class KineticState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.components.kineticcomponent.KineticState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IKineticEngineContext

    public class KineticState
extends java.lang.Object
implements IKineticEngineContext
    A wrapper class to store the complete state of the client-side KineticComponent. Under normal circumstances, all this could be defined in KineticComponentWidget (and it previously was). However, this class is needed when tabs are changed. Vaadin then destroys the currently displayed client-side KineticComponent and recreates it again later from the shared state, if needed (where none of this information is stored, mainly because of performance).
    If such a situation occurs, the current client-side state defined in this class is backed up in KineticStateRegistrar, from which it is also later picked up and restored.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

    • Method Detail

      • setParentWidget

        public void setParentWidget(KineticComponentWidget parentWidget)
        This method is needed to be called after the client-side kinetic state defined by this class is recreated (see the class's Javadoc).
        Vaadin then creates a new instance of KineticComponentWidget and it needs to be registered with the state, otherwise weird errors will pop up.
